Pepsi is a carbonated soft drink manufactured by PepsiCo. Originally created and developed in 1893 by Caleb Bradham and introduced as Brad's Drink, it was renamed as Pepsi-Cola on August 28, 1898, then to Pepsi in 1961, and in select areas of North America, Pepsi-Cola Made with Real Sugar as of 2014.
A soft drink is a beverage that typically contains water, a sweetener, and a flavoring agent.
